description.narrative: Funding under this initiative is to support the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade (DFAT) to deliver the Trade Policy Course Program in May 2011 which will include up to eight Latin American participants. The 5 day training course will cover a range of topics and draw on a range of industry, academic and government (including AusAID) trade experts to deliver the course. The course objectives are to: equip participants with the knowledge, skills and ability to formulate trade policy and to report on other countries' trade policies; familiarise participants with key issues and challenges on the international trade policy agenda; provide an understanding of the World trade Organisation (WTO). The total value of this initiative is $0.1 million expensed in the 2010-11 financial year.
